poem:
### Diplomacy at Dawn

The ink of warning
spills across morning tables.

A leader postures with shadows 
and the echo of an old empire.

Here, in the stillness of kitchens,
coffee cools.

Words harden into missiles;  
the clock ticks towards another noon.

But today, just now,
birds are weaving a new song.
